description: Private 18C Seven Acre Lake, part of the dismantled Canons Mansion grounds, now surrounded by 1930s character housing. Wildlife includes Canada geese, swans and ducks.

events.name: Drop in: Open Day at the Seven Acre Lake at  Canons Park Estate
events.notes: Last tour of the lake starts at 4pm.  All visitors to leave the lake by 5pm please.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: The area that we live in is unique in London offering history, beauty and nature within a suburban location.

In all, there are over 320 houses and 66 flats on the Estate, which was created in the 1930s. At the same time, the Canons Park Estate Association (now Canons Park Estate Limited) was formed to maintain the trees, lakes and grass verges that formed the surplus lands left over after the area was divided up for housing, having originally formed part of the huge estate of the first Duke of Chandos, in the 18th century.

factsheet.heading: The Two Lakes
paragraphs: Canons Drive, with its magnificent avenue of Wellingtonia trees, provides a beautiful backdrop to a number of locally-listed "Arts and Crafts" or "black and white" Tudor-style houses, which also feature in the small closes and side roads that lead off it.

Our two lakes, which include the Seven Acre Lake (private, and surrounded by houses) and the Basin Lake on Canons Drive – for which we allow access to the general public – provide an opportunity for Residents and visitors alike to enjoy nature first hand, in a setting that is forever changing from season to season.

location.address: Rose Garden Close, off Canons Drive, Edgware, HA8 7RF
travel_info: Additional travel info: Off-street parking in Canons Drive and surrounding roads.

name: Seven Acre Lake, Canons Park Estate
